meta.name: generator
meta.content: HTML Tidy for Windows (vers 25 March 2009), see www.w3.org

div.p: This plugin allows you to use Coverity to analyze and find defects in C++, C#, and Java source code.
For more information, see the Coverity Static Analysis page.
This plugin was developed and tested with Coverity version 5.3.0.
IMPORTANT: For all parameter descriptions below, required parameters are shown in bold italics.
IMPORTANT: In the ElectricFlow UI, go to the Home page, open the Main Menu, and click Admin > Plugins to open the Plugin Manager.
See the ElectricFlow online help system for details about how to use this plugin within a procedure.
When you provide information for this plugin, fill in the fields as follows:

ul.li: Coverity bin folder—Supply the path to the Coverity bin folder. For example: C:/Program files/Coverity/Coverity Static Analysis/bin. Otherwise, the default location will be assumed.
Intermediate Directory—Provide the path to the directory containing the code base's intermediate representation and output from the analysis step.
Language—Select the language used in your project.
Build command—Provide the command you normally use to run your build. If the command contains a path, enclose it in quotes.
Debug—If checked, this turns on basic debugging output.
Verbosity level—Set the detail level of command messages. Higher numbers provide more verbosity (more messages).
C# assembly files—Provide C# assembly files (.exe or .dll) to analyze. This option is needed only when you use C#. You must separate multiple file or path names with a space.
Configuration file—Use the specified configuration file instead of the default configuration.
Additional commands for cov-build—Enter any additional commands.
Additional commands for (cov-analyze/cov-analyze-java/cov-analyze-cs)—Enter any additional commands.
Working directory—Enter the desired working directory. Leave blank to use the default workspace.
The plugin icon has been updated.
